text: police in northern ireland's say that
any witnesses to the dissident
republican murder of journalist Lera
McKee will be offered anonymity if they
agree to give evidence against her
killers she was shot dead two weeks ago
by the new IRA a killing which has
sparked a backlash against the
hardliners who continued to launch
attacks more than 20 years after the
signing of the Northern Ireland
agreement that ended the troubles our
island correspondent emma Vardy reports
from Londonderry on the efforts to stop
the violence
[Music]
the specter of an old conflict still
haunts this city now Derry is trying to
heal new wounds
the violence which led to the death of
Lera McKee was orchestrated by so-called
dissident republicans they see
themselves as part of a decades-old
struggle against British rule in
Northern Ireland I would just see them
lay down your arms stop the whole thing

any words for Larry Mackey's family see
